intro: Cyrtochilum sodiroi, commonly known as the Sodiro's orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, terrestrial growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with intricate patterns on the petals and sepals. Cyrtochilum sodiroi thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
